title: Willie McOustra
text:
William McOustra (1881–1953) was a Scottish professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as an <a href="left%20half">left half</a> and <a href="inside%20right">inside right</a> in the <a href="The%20Football%20League">Football League</a> for <a href="Manchester%20City%20F.C.">Manchester City</a>. He also played in the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish League</a> for <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> and later served on the <a href="Groundsman">groundstaff</a> at <a href="Celtic%20Park">Celtic Park</a>.
Personal life.
In September 1914, one month after the outbreak of the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a>, McOustra enlisted as a <a href="Private%20%28rank%29">private</a> in the <a href="Scots%20Guards">Scots Guards</a>. He arrived on the <a href="Western%20Front%20%28World%20War%20I%29">Western Front</a> in March 1915 and was <a href="Military%20discharge">medically discharged</a> from the <a href="British%20Army%20during%20World%20War%20I">army</a> in September 1917, due to a <a href="gunshot%20wound">gunshot wound</a> to the right knee.
